newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary BUX ends at fifth closing high in row.
newsitem.headline: Hungary BUX ends at fifth closing high in row.

text.p: Hungarian share prices finished at a fifth successive closing high on Tuesday, driven by the absence of any bad news rather than on the back of any fresh development, market participants said.
The BUX index finished at a preliminary 7,241.09 points, up 43.27.

Market participants said it would be time for some downward corrections but they added the market might survive the summer with a slightly positive tone on the back of the country's positive assessment.

"As a result of positive corporate earnings and improving macrgeconomic figures the market may maintain its levels and would not fall," said Robert Cselovszki of WestLB Investment. "At least the market points to this direction."
He added, however, that he maintained his opinion that a minor correction will come due to summer holidays.
An analyst expected the market's slightly positive trend to remain, as the cash inflow into the Hungarian market would continue, albeit at a slower pace.
"A mildly positive trend will prevail for some more weeks, simply because there isn't any bad news,"0said Andrea Dicso, analyst at Bank Austria-Investment Rt.
BUX futures also continued their upward moves, boosting yield content. September BUX finished at 7,439 points, compared to Monday's settlement price of 7,400 points.
On Tuesday, pharmaceuticals Egis Rt EGIS.BU remained among top gainers, adding almost five percent or 650 forints, to finish at a new closing high of 14,300 forints.
Chemicals TVK maintained its rally and finished at a new high of 3,720 forints, up 90.
Elsewhere, tinned food manufacturer Globus firmed to a new high of 2,750 forints, before retreating to finish at 2,500 forints, up 100.
